careerSingle.coreResponsibilities:
• Maintain and update the general ledger, recording financial transactions accurately.
• Reconcile accounts and ensure the accuracy of financial statements.
• Prepare and file various tax returns, including income tax, sales tax, and other regulatory
filings.
• Review tax codes and classifications to ensure compliance with local, state, and federal
regulations.
• Collaborate with external auditors and tax consultants during audits and tax reviews.
• Analyze financial data to identify trends, discrepancies, and opportunities for process
improvement.
• Provide support in month-end and year-end closing activities.
• Assist in the preparation of financial reports and presentations for management.
• Stay updated with changes in tax laws, regulations, and accounting standards.
• Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as finance, legal, and operations, to ensure
alignment on financial matters.

careerSingle.jobPurposes:
Tax and General Ledger Accountant is responsible for managing financial records, maintaining the
general ledger, and ensuring accurate and timely tax compliance. This role involves reconciling
financial transactions, preparing tax documents, and collaborating with internal teams to support
the company’s financial operations.
careerSingle.qualification:
• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
• Professional certification such as CPD (Continuing Professional Development) preferred.
• Proven experience in tax accounting and general ledger management.
• Strong understanding of tax regulations and compliance requirements.
• Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Excel.
• Attention to detail and accuracy in financial data management.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
• Analytical mindset and problem-solving abilities.
• Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.
